title: Will the World Trade Organization's Iran Working Party meet before 1 January 2018?
preds: I doubt anything will happen in the next week.
No meetings, and not while Israel, Saudi Arabia and USA are so anti Iran.

An Iranian government delegation has headed to the 11th World Trade Organisation Summit in Buenos Aires to represent Iran as an official observer country, Islamic Republic News Agency said on December 11.

From July 1996 to May 2001, Iran’s application had not been considered, mainly as a result of US objections and the US veto power in the WTO Council. From May 2001 Iran’s application for WTO membership has been brought up 22 times. At the 22nd time, on 26 May 2005, Iran’s application for WTO membership was approved unanimously by the organization’s members (and thus by the United States and Israel as a goodwill gesture so as to ease the nuclear negotiations between Iran and the international community). 
________________________________
COMMENT:  Not a chance now....

Or maybe I could get appointed to it, since I have considerable experience in not going to meetings.

Long road ahead for Iran s bid to join World Trade Organization

2017 Is going to be an interesting year for the Iranian situation. Today, you have their support for the Syrian Regime ready to pay dividends in the upcoming international negotiations, the regime in Syria cannot operate without Russian and Iran, that is working on Iran's favor, their Geopolitical area of influence is getting stronger, so you can see Putin keep improving relations with the Iranian leaders.t 
At the same time you have pro Russian been nominated at the cabinet getting form by DJT. Very interesting, that DJT as campaigned on Natahayu's platform in relation to the situation with Iran which is the opposite than Russian's direction.  
Now, trade deals, the Airbus deal is going to put lots of pressure in Europe,  the conservatives in Europe have lost in England a fighter an allied, and now thanks to Brexit, the progressive movement in Strasburg are pushing back to the US, some conservatives that were not aligned with the US have it easier to undermine the influence of the US in the EU, with the English out of the decision making cabinets in Strasburg, the optics are clear. 
 Still with all these dynamics, there are not enough to get Iran at the table to be a Working Party, consensus will not be reached.
 I am not going to go all the way to 0 but it is not far.

“The WTO accession process is based on consensus, and as of now, there are a number of countries that oppose appointing a chair to Iran’s working party on accession,” the official said, describing the process involved in joining. “The U.S. also does not currently support naming a chair.”
http://www.wsj.com/articles/lawmakers-urge-u-s-to-block-irans-wto-bid-1475793488

COMMENTS: Based on the above and the Trump Presidency, it looks very unlikely
According to the general news and GJP consensus.

I was curious about why they have never met.  The problem is that there must be consensus among WTO members to appoint a chair to the working party and a number of countries will not agree to do it.  See http://www.wsj.com/articles/lawmakers-urge-u-s-to-block-irans-wto-bid-1475793488 .
It is almost impossible see this happening without US support. Given previous US vetoes and the Trump’s position on the Iran nuclear deal this is extremely unlikely.
"how the process of Iran’s accession to the WTO will unfold"

Iran's Working Party was established on 26 May 2005. The Working Party has not yet met. In over 11 years! Not even once. No future meeting is scheduled either.
https://www.wto.org/english/thewto_e/acc_e/a1_iran_e.htm#status
Base rate is currently 0; and the odds may have declined with the new US administration.

President Littlefingers will contest this.  The Iranians will insist on it.  Which one gets their way will tell us much about the place of the US in the world order for the foreseeable future.  Should be interesting.

Trump might want to punish both Iran and Boeing. By retracting the nuclear deal, support for WTO accession becomes more difficult. By vilifying Boeing and associating it with Iran, he can push his retributory agenda further. http://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-encourages-firms-to-make-deals-with-iran-in-bid-to-cement-nuclear-deal-1466727183 http://www.foxbusiness.com/markets/2016/12/06/trump-tweets-cancel-order-on-boeings-new-air-force-one-because-costs-are-out-control.html

Since no meetings were scheduled between 2015 and 2016, it is somewhat likely that some meeting(s) will not occur prior to Jan 1, 2018.  Given constraints and potential changes in the Trump foreign policy approach to Iran, a decrease in activity within trading regimes will constrict somewhat, but additionally, Iran's response to it.  If the Iranians react negatively to the Trump administration's approach to its country and the nuclear deal falls apart, additional sanctions from various states and international institutions are likely contain imports into Iran.
